bioghist.p: Samuel Emlen was a member of the Burlington (New Jersey) Monthly Meeting and was the founder of the Emlen Institute for the Education of Orphan Boys of African and Indian Descent. He was married to Susanna Dillwyn.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of ground rents, probably belonging to Samuel Emlen, for various properties in and around Philadelphia for the years 1837 and 1838. Renters included individuals, such as Horace Binney, Jr. and Samuel Chubb, as well as churches and businesses, such as the African Episcopal Church, Friends Asylum, and St. Thomas' African Church. The volume also lists dividends and loan payments made to Emlen or his estate.
